title: Docs Overview
description: Documentation is made up of `.json` and `.md` files in the `/docs/data` directory. All existing documentation SHOULD be edited for a new project, or whenever anything changes.

Browncoat ships with some default documentation (see top level navigation and `scss` subsection). Documentation functionality MUST be modified by editing `/src/js/docs.js` (and required files). Documentation specific styling MUST be modified by editing `/src/scss/docs.scss`. Documentation styles will also change as styles are developed for the project.

sections.title: Existing Pages
description: URL paths are resolved in `/src/js/docs.js` by fetching the corresponding data files. Data files are broken up in two parts an `.md` file and a `.json` file. They are found in `/docs/data`. Content changes and code sample changes MUST be made in these files.
For example: the path `/scss/bits` will tell browncoat docs to get `/data/scss/bits.json` and `/data/scss/bits.md` and generate our doc page.
This will work for all paths defined in `/docs/data/_main.json` (both `projectNav` and `sectionNavs` items).

sections.title: _main.json
description: Sets up the browncoat docs. See anotated file below.

sections.title: Anatomy of a .json file
description: `.json` files contain the page title, description, and sections. Each section is displayed as a box within the page. They have a title, description, footer, optional code sample, and optional rendered code sample. Code samples are stored in the corresponding `.md` file.
For example: This file `/docs/data/docs.json` has a section (this section) which asks for the code sample "json" from `/docs/data/docs.md`. The anotated json sample below is the result.

sections.title: Anatomy of an .md file
description: `.md` files contain code samples. Code samples MUST start with a key using 3 hashtags (#). They MUST be separated by three dashes (-). Sample code must be surrounded by 3 backticks (`) on either end with an optional language specificed.
